keyword: how many calories in a tuna salad sandwich
title: How Many Calories in a Tuna Salad Sandwich?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a tuna salad sandwich, including full nutrition breakdown, protein, fat, carbs, and easy recipe tweaks for lighter options.
h1: How Many Calories in a Tuna Salad Sandwich?
assumptions: Standard recipe: 100g canned tuna in water (drained), 2 tbsp mayo, diced celery/onion, on 2 slices whole wheat bread; no added cheese or veggies.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, recipe, portion size, bread type, and mayo amount. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A typical tuna salad sandwich contains about 380 kcal and 20 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use light mayo (1 tbsp instead of 2)

faqs.q: How many calories in a tuna salad sandwich with mayo?
faqs.a: About 380 kcal for a standard version with 2 tbsp mayo and whole wheat bread.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a tuna salad sandwich?
faqs.a: Typically 20 g protein from the tuna and bread.

faqs.q: How to make a low-calorie tuna salad sandwich?
faqs.a: Use Greek yogurt instead of mayo and add veggies to cut ~100 kcal.

faqs.q: Does bread type affect calories in tuna salad sandwich?
faqs.a: Yes, whole wheat adds fiber but similar calories to white; opt for thin slices to reduce.

faqs.q: How much sodium in a tuna salad sandwich?
faqs.a: Around 700 mg, mostly from canned tuna and bread; choose low-sodium tuna to lower it.
